arm_group.description: Infant Subjects who are treated with fluconazole

brief_summary.textblock:
To collect the efficacy and safety information of fluconazole on infant subjects related to
      their appropriate use in daily practice.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diflucan Research For Infant Evaluation Of Antifungal Treatment And Prophylaxis Medication

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male or Female under age of seven patients who are prescribed fluconazole (Diflucan)
             for antifungal treatment or prophylaxis administration.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subject of seven years or more who have been prescribed fluconazole.

study_pop.textblock:
The patients whom an investigator involving A0561022 prescribes the fluconazole
        (Diflucan).

intervention.description:
Candidiasis infection: The recommended dosage in children is 3 mg/kg once daily.
Cryptococcal infection: The recommended dosage in children is 6 mg/kg once daily. A dosage of 12 mg/kg once daily may be used, based on medical judgment of the patient's response to therapy.
Prophylactic administration for deep mycosis on Hematopoietic stem cell transplantation: The recommended dosage in children is 12 mg/kg once daily.
Absolute doses exceeding 600 mg/day are not recommended.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.official_title: Special Investigation Of Diflucan For Infant Subjects

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) by Seriousness and Relationship to Treatment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Clinical Response of Cure at the Test-of-Cure (TOC) Visit

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
